AD_GoblinsInCombat.synopsis: The goblins have just been attacked by the player - they know the player is probably going to kill then.
AD_GoblinsInCombat.how_to_trigger: During the execution scene with Ketheric/Z'rell, choose to attack the goblins when Z'rell asks you to kill them.

Guard_001.synopsis: Female Half-orc guard, a magic user and Absolute cultist.
Guard_001.how_to_trigger:
- Use Debug book, go to MOO region > Moonrise tower entrance- 
goto -151.11, 27.80, -212.95- After the triggered dialog ends, speak to Fanatic Mola

Guard_006.synopsis: Female Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.

Guard_002.synopsis: Male Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.

AD_SazzaPlea.synopsis: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

AD_DarraPlea.synopsis: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

individual_metadata.synopsis: When we arrive in Moonrise towers, we almost immediately stumble upon a drow True Soul executing three goblins. Critpath.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the Throne Room on the ground floor of Moonrise Towers. The dialog will begin as you approach Ketheric, Z'Rell, Minthara or the goblins.

AD_DrennPlea.synopsis: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

Guard_005.synopsis: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist. Magic user.

DaisyAD_PostExecution.synopsis: The execution scene in Moonrise just finished where the player would have witnessed Ketheric taking a spear and walking it off. Daisy will want to tell the player to push for more information and find the source of his powers (Nightsong).
DaisyAD_PostExecution.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Agoto -152; 23; -193Complete the execution dialog (without attacking Ketheric/Z'rell)

Guard_003.synopsis: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist.
Guard_003.how_to_trigger:
- Use Debug book, go to MOO region > Moonrise tower entrance- 
goto -150.04, 23.81, -187.38- 
After the triggered dialog ends, speak to Zealot Falla

AD_FezzerkPlea.synopsis: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

AD_MintharaPlea.synopsis: Minthara is pleading for her life before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

CombatInterruption.synopsis: Ketheric leaves after delegating Z'rell to deal with the players.
CombatInterruption.how_to_trigger: Players attack Ketheric in MOO_Execution or disrupt the scene while it is under way.

Guard_004.synopsis: Male Half Orc. Guard and Absolute cultist.

AD_GoblinsInCombat_0.speaker: Darra
AD_GoblinsInCombat_0.text: I won't go easy, if that's what yeh think.
AD_GoblinsInCombat_0.context: NodeContext: The drow that was controlling your actions just died and you're about to run away

AD_GoblinsInCombat_1.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_GoblinsInCombat_1.text: I ain't making this easy for yeh!

AD_GoblinsInCombat_2.speaker: Sazza
AD_GoblinsInCombat_2.text: Come on then - let's have yeh.

Guard_001_0.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_0.text: The General's advisor is back. Anyone left in the cells better start praying.
Guard_001_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Almost pities the  prisoners - the man he speaks of loves toying with prisoners

Guard_001_1.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_1.text: Best get yourself ready. Order's come down - we march.
Guard_001_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

Guard_001_2.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_2.text: You're not the first to brave the dark for the Absolute. The war camps are full to bursting.
Guard_001_2.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)

Guard_001_3.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_3.text: I've never been to Baldur's Gate. Make sure to leave some standing for us, eh?
Guard_001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

Guard_001_4.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_4.text: The General's advisor is back. He won't be happy to find empty cells below.
Guard_001_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Ominous, referring to a man who likes to torture prisoners

Guard_001_5.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001_5.text: Step wise around the Disciple - I've seen her do some dark things in this room.
Guard_001_5.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Soft, wary - they're all on the same side, but she's warning us againt the Disciple

Guard_006_0.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006_0.text: I swore myself to Lolth for years. But she never let me sack a city.
Guard_006_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Looking forward to the fight to come

Guard_006_1.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006_1.text: Show no mercy in the battles to come. The Absolute watches us all.
Guard_006_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Relishing the battles to come

Guard_006_2.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006_2.text: No feuding under this roof, True Soul. We're all one under the Absolute - more's the pity.
Guard_006_2.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Cocky but friendly - used to infighting and almost regretful that the cult is so unified

Guard_006_3.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006_3.text: I'd stick to your own provisions. They've got gnolls working the kitchens here.
Guard_006_3.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: One veteran to another

Guard_002_0.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_0.text: To the city, True Soul! The waiting's done.
Guard_002_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Quietly fanatic - can't wait to march

Guard_002_1.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_1.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)

Guard_002_2.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.NodeContext: A blessing / greeting

Guard_002_3.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_3.text: You bested the Selûnite. You'll have to regale us all over drinks.
Guard_002_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped the cult kidnap Isobel and bring her to Moonrise.

Guard_002_4.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_4.text: You'll be the General's favourite after this.
Guard_002_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

Guard_002_5.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002_5.text: Good luck, True Soul. The Disciple demands much of those who serve her.
Guard_002_5.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)

AD_SazzaPlea_0.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea_0.text: I didn't survive mad druids and hungry spiders to die here.

AD_SazzaPlea_1.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea_1.text: Don't hurt me, Ketheric. I'm loyal!
AD_SazzaPlea_1.context: NodeContext: raising voice to be heard in a noisy room

AD_SazzaPlea_2.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea_2.text: Should have stayed in that cage.

AD_DarraPlea_0.speaker: Darra
AD_DarraPlea_0.context: NodeContext: a plea to nobody in particular

AD_DarraPlea_2.speaker: Darra
AD_DarraPlea_2.text: We should never have come here.

28.speaker: Drenn
28.text: I did as I was told! Followed every order I was given -

291.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
291.text: The facts suggest otherwise. You were ordered to retrieve the artefact - you failed to do so.

85.speaker: Sazza
85.text: We did as you lot told us. Minthara's the one who -

46.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Via mind meldNodeContext: Via mind meld

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *A blast of mental energy washes over you, filling the room. Your tadpole squirms, urging you to obey.*

283.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
283.text: You failed to retrieve the artefact. You failed to protect your True Soul. You do not deserve to live.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: Don't kill them! They're loyal followers of the Absolute.

255.speaker: Narrator
255.text: *As the General's attention shifts to you, a memory stirs - a memory of this room, and his voice raised in anger.*
255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric turns to appraise the player

224.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
224.text: I'm surprised to see you again, True Soul. You are here to assist and not to meddle, I trust.

295.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
295.text: I would remind you that while in my halls, you obey me - just as you would any other Chosen.

44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
44.text: I'm sure you will enjoy watching my justice enacted.

317.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
317.text: You have to take what pleasure you can, after all, in your diminished state.

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *His smirk says everything and nothing at once. 'I know exactly who you are, and I will never tell.'*

190.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
190.text: Better than you know yourself, it seems.
190.context: NodeContext: with a smile - he just realised the player has lost their memories and that might work to his advantage

306.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
306.text: But we are here to deal with these goblins, not to speak of your past.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I don't care for a trial. An execution, however...

243.speaker: Player
243.text: What makes you so sure I'll enjoy the judgement?

160.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
160.text: I have seen the acts you revel in. You are no soldier - you are a scourge.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Look around the room, trying to remember it.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *You've stood afore this very throne before, in demand, not supplication.*

308.speaker: Narrator
308.text: *Many eyes in the room dart away when you try to meet them. Hells, they all know you. Even the dog knows you.*

139.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
139.text: Ah, the True Soul who delivered a grove of non-believers into the Absolute's arms.

337.speaker: Drenn
337.text: We did as we were told! We're loyal to the Absolute - tell 'im!

166.speaker: Sazza
166.text: You! Me old mate that saved me from the tieflings -

189.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
189.text: True Soul. You have seen these goblins at work, have you not? What say you?
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressing playerNodeContext: Almost bored with the proceedings. Wanting to fob off judgement to someone else. He's thisclose to getting his daughter back; punishing goblins doesn't interest him.

350.speaker: Player
350.text: They're faithful to the Absolute, I'll give them that.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Death is probably too good for them.

76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
76.text: Alas, it's the best option we have.

201.speaker: Drenn
201.text: You ain't serious. You can't be.

169.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Z'Rell as he stands up to leave.NodeContext: Standing up to leave

77.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
77.text: Ah, the True Soul who saved poor, lost Nere from his mistakes.

48.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
48.text: Ah, the True Soul who so impressed Dror Ragzlin.

208.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
208.text: A new True Soul, come to share their wisdom?

264.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
264.context: NodeContext: Ketheric is almost bored with the proceedings. This isn't his interest- retrieving Isobel is.

151.speaker: Fezzerk
151.text: Us? No no, it was Minthara. She got the orders, she -

221.speaker: Drenn
221.text: Take it up with Minthara. She's the one who -

202.speaker: Sazza
202.text: It ain't our fault, General! We did as we were told -

265.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
265.text: I will not be slandered! General, you saw my reports - you know it's not my fault.

239.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
239.text: The facts suggest otherwise. You were ordered to retrieve the artefact - you failed to do so.

253.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
253.text: If I had been given drow warriors instead of goblin trash -

49.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Via mind meldNodeContext: Via mind meld

299.speaker: Narrator
299.text: *A blast of mental energy washes over you, filling the room. Your tadpole squirms, urging you to obey.*

109.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
109.text: Let me make sure I understand this - you're claiming that General Thorm gave you the wrong soldiers?
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'Rell turns back to MintharaNodeContext: To Minthara

339.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
339.context: NodeContext: Realises she's said the wrong thing, quickly corrects herself

13.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
13.text: You blame the Absolute's Chosen for your failure?

40.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
40.text: Of course it is not the General's fault -

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Use your power to influence Minthara - try to force her to admit her guilt.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *You slip into Minthara's mind while all her attention is focused on saving her own skin. You can feel her guilt everywhere, writhing and churning. All it takes is one little push...*

22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
22.text: Mine! It's - it's my fault. I failed you, my lord. Please, forgive me.

47.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'Rell is surprised - she wasn't expecting an easy confession. She turns to Ketheric, who's considering Minthara's words.NodeContext: Z'Rell is surprised - she wasn't expecting an easy confession. She turns to Ketheric, who's considering Minthara's words.

66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
66.text: I gave you this command because I saw something in you. Your efficiency - ruthlessness - your killer's instinct. I treasured them all.

262.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
262.text: But honesty? Remorse? These are no use to me.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You try to slip past Minthara's defences, but her parasite is on high alert. No matter what nook you probe, it's there - blocking you from interfering.*

276.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
276.text: The goblins! They failed me. They failed us all.

101.speaker: Drenn
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins erupt in protest. Ketheric raises a hand and the goblins fall silent

248.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
248.text: And what would you do to those that have failed you?

33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
33.text: They are put to death, obviously.
33.context: NodeContext: Confidently, she thinks she's getting away with it

99.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
99.text: True, ultimate failure must earn ultimate punishment.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Z'Rell looks to Ketheric, who nods.NodeContext: Nodding in agreement.

17.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
17.text: Nightwarden Minthara, your crime is incompetence and your sentence is death.

342.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
342.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara falls to her kneesNodeContext: Minthara falls to her knees

257.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
257.text: Make her passing slow, Disciple Z'rell. Be creative.
257.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to Z'Rell as guards move to seize Minthara

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I could make it much more creative. As a torturer, I am unmatched.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Why not kill her here? Be done with it.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I smell a massacre. Let it begin.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Let me torture her - I am a master.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Don't kill her - she's a loyal servant of the Absolute.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *As the General's attention shifts to you, a memory stirs - a memory of this room, and his voice raised in anger.*
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric turns to appraise the player

293.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
293.text: I'm surprised to see you again, True Soul. You are here to assist and not to meddle, I trust.

120.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
120.text: I would remind you that while in my halls, you obey me - just as you would any other Chosen.

56.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
56.text: What say you about our Minthara? It is fitting that one mad dog should judge another.

343.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
343.text: Ah! The True Soul who retrieved the Nightsong - it is good to make your acquaintance.

309.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
309.text: Ah! The True Soul who eliminated my Harper enemies in one fell swoop - welcome.

102.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
102.text: Ah! The True Soul who retrieved Isobel - good of you to make yourself known.

273.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
273.text: Fitting that a loyal servant should pass judgement on a failure. What say you about our Minthara?

301.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
301.text: Ah, the True Soul who delivered a grove of non-believers into the Absolute's arms.

216.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
216.text: Ah, the True Soul who saved poor, lost Nere from his mistakes.

153.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
153.text: Ah, the True Soul who so impressed Dror Ragzlin.

30.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
30.text: A new True Soul, come to share their wisdom?

152.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
152.text: And what do you have to contribute?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: You know me? You know of my madness?

197.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
197.text: Better than you know yourself, it seems.
197.context: NodeContext: with a smile - he just realised the player has lost their memories and that might work to his advantage

143.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
143.text: But we are here to speak of Minthara, not you.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Make her suffer, until pain is all she knows.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: She's a valuable soldier - she serves the Absolute faithfully.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: What do you intend to do with her?

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I did all the hard work - she'd be dead already without my help.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: She's not lying - she served the Absolute faithfully.

329.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
329.text: A pity, then, that her faith was so inadequate.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: What will you do with her?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Only that she'd be dead in the wilds if not for my help.

79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
79.text: As if more evidence were needed.

320.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
320.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to guardsNodeContext: An order given to his guards

238.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: Being dragged away.NodeContext: Being dragged away.

135.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stands from his throneNodeContext: An afterthought, as he stands up to leave

225.speaker: Drenn
225.text: You creaking old bag of shit!
225.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drenn grabs a halberd from a surprised guard and hurls it at KETHERIC. It hits him full-force in the chest and he stumbles backwards, falling into his chair.NodeContext: Drenn grabs a halberd from a surprised guard and throws it at Ketheric.

158.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: After his initial shock reaction, Ketheric grabs the halberd with one hand and pulls it free. The wound left by the blade is just a glowing purple gash, which disappears before our eyes, leaving his chest without even a scratch.NodeContext: KETHERIC stares at the halberd embedded in his chest in shock. Then, after a beat, he grunts in anger and pain as with one hand he grabs the halberd and pulls it free. The wound left by the blade is just a glowing purple gash, which disappears before our eyes, leaving his chest without even a scratch.

114.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
114.text: I'm so sorry, my lord. She's an unbeliever - outside my control.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric walks over to the terrified goblinNodeContext: Very apologetic - this should never have happened

326.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
326.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric drops the halberd at the goblin's feet.NodeContext: Ketheric drops the halberd on the ground and challenges the goblin.

269.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
269.context: CinematicNodeContext: The terrified goblin picks up the halberd and swings to decapitate Ketheric, but it crashes into his neck, cracking bone. He doesn't flinch. Ketheric pulls out the halberd, which also leaves a glowing purple wound, and tosses it aside.NodeContext: Just been stabbed, but is invulnerable.

271.speaker: Drenn
271.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric brings two heavy, mailed fists down on the goblin, killing Drenn where she stands.NodeContext: terrified - you know you're about to die

281.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
281.text: Dispose of the rest as you see fit.

198.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
198.text: Or better yet - let us take advantage of our surprising guest, and their particular creative genius.

93.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
93.text: I'm sure the results will send a clear message to the troops on the importance of discipline.

341.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
341.text: Or better yet - put that True Soul to use. They've proven themselves reliable.

5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
5.text: Or better yet - put that True Soul to use. They've proven themselves reliable.

161.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
161.text: Of course, my lord. Thank you.

134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric leaves the throne room

132.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
132.text: You heard the General. The goblins are yours - deal with them however you wish.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: What am I meant to do with them, exactly?

122.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
122.text: They are yours. You can release them, kill them, or feed them to each other for all I care. Just deal with them.

242.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
242.text: Here, in the seat of the Absolute's power, your authority over them is complete. They will obey any command.

200.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
200.text: Report to me upstairs when you're done.

321.speaker: Sazza
321.text: You wouldn't hurt me, would you? We're mates, me and you. Practically family!

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Split yourselves open. Crack-crack! And smile while you work!

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Spill your guts on the floor. I want to see you bleed.

229.speaker: Fezzerk
229.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.NodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.

194.speaker: Sazza
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.NodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: I do enjoy a bit of casual bloodshed. Now come - I'd like to know more about this 'Z'rell'.

237.speaker: Astarion
237.text: Done, nice and neat. Now, let's report to the lovely Z'rell.

235.speaker: Karlach
235.text: Well. That's done with. Might as well go say hello to Z'rell, then.
235.context: NodeContext: A little uncertain. Not into the bloodshed.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: They're dead. Z'rell will want to hear of this.

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *In another lifetime, you were greeted in this throne room like a God, not the living wreck you are now.*

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *Your disgrace has something to do with this Ketheric. You yearn to flay him until he forgets himself, as you have.*

330.speaker: Player
330.text: Grit your teeth and ignore the feeling. Making a scene won't answer your questions.

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *With difficulty, you banish the pooling evil that bewitches your quivering limbs.*

227.speaker: Narrator
227.text: *Perhaps parts of you were scattered in this spire. Time to knit yourself together.*

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Indulge in your thoughts of lacerating him.

340.speaker: Narrator
340.text: *He healed up a treat - he could enjoy your cuts forever and a day.*

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Whoever he is, he stands in your way.

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *Nothing sickens you more than a man who is unkillable. But to a veteran deviant such as yourself, it is but a matter of time.*

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Let's go see Z'rell - and mind you don't slip in the goblin guts.

228.speaker: Wyll
228.text: Ketheric plays a cruel game, and you had no choice but to play. Now let's talk to Z'rell.

103.speaker: Darra
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.NodeContext: Goblins pull out his swords, stab themselves in the stomach, and yanks it to one side. With pained gurgles they fall to the floor, dead.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Not another word. In fact - not another breath from any of you.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I'll give you a fair chance. Fight me - you either die, or you kill me and you're free to go.

259.speaker: Sazza
259.text: You serious? We don't stand a chance!

57.speaker: Fezzerk
57.text: Oh, crap. You're gonna enjoy this, ain't you?
57.context: InternalNodeContext: If Fezzerk is still alive.

25.speaker: Darra
25.text: You serious? We don't stand a chance!

333.speaker: Player
333.text: It shall be trial by combat. If you wish to live, you must champion yourself.

355.speaker: Player
355.text: An animal shows its true strength only when cornered. Show me yours. FIGHT.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I will do this with my own hands, it always feels better.

62.speaker: Sazza
62.text: You won't regret this. Praise the Absolute!

260.speaker: Lae'zel
260.text: You exhaust me. Compassion is not a virtue.

263.speaker: Astarion
263.text: Mercy? You showed goblins mercy? The half-orc won't like this.

252.speaker: Karlach
252.text: You did the right thing. I'm sure those nasties deserved a bollocking, but we're no executioners. Let's go see what Z'rell makes of it.

307.speaker: Gale
307.text: Z'rell won't be pleased about this - she strikes me as the type to enjoy a little bloodshed.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: Your merciful streak will be the death of us one day. Let's hope Z'rell won't be too angry.
136.context: NodeContext: Player freed some goblin captives after being left to decide their fate.

268.speaker: Fezzerk
268.text: Praise the Absolute! And praise Her True Soul!
268.context: InternalNodeContext: If Fezzerk is still alive.

69.speaker: Darra
69.text: Praise the Absolute! And praise you, True Soul!

185.speaker: Fezzerk
185.text: Please - you gotta help me. For old times' sake?
185.context: InternalNodeContext: If Fezzerk is still alive.

266.speaker: Darra
266.text: Here, you ain't gonna do anything drastic, are yeh? We've been nothing but loyal!

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Thank you, I'm going to enjoy this...

164.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
164.context: NodeContext: responding to "I'm going to enjoy this..."

108.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
108.text: Or better yet - put that True Soul to use. You have far more important matters to attend to - or have you forgotten?

250.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
250.text: Of course not, my lord. Thank you.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Why not kill her here, General? Be done with it.

80.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
80.text: Happy as I would be to kill her here, Disciple Z'Rell asked for this honour long ago.

251.speaker: Narrator
251.text: *Ketheric stiffens at the sight of you. He seems to recognise you.*

186.speaker: Player
186.text: Mentally influence Z'rell - make her show Minthara mercy.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Z'rell's mind is a steel trap, but you cautiously ease your way in. You just need to shift her focus a little...*

43.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
43.text: I'm being unkind. Anyone might have struggled with such imperfect tools - goblins are prone to failure.

222.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
222.text: I - yes! It's the goblins' fault. They failed you, General, not me.

130.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
130.context: NodeContext: Deferring to her boss - what would he like done with Minthara?

218.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
218.text: Take Minthara below. Someone will have to consider her fate.
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to guards, who grab Minthara and lead her away.InternalNodeContext: To his guards

187.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: All eyes turn to the player

279.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
279.text: You have seen what these creatures are capable of, and you have seen their inadequacies - isn't that so? What is your judgement?

20.speaker: Sazza
20.text: You! Me old mate that saved me from the tieflings -

336.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
336.text: Enough! True Soul - tell the General how the goblins served our cause.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: They're faithful soldiers. You should set them free.

61.speaker: Sazza
61.text: Exactly! 'S what I told 'em, but would they listen?

204.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
204.text: Faith without action is anaemic, sickly. In a word, useless.

65.speaker: Fezzerk
65.text: See? What'd I tell yeh? Praise the Absolute!

175.speaker: Drenn
175.text: Thank you. 'S good to be appreciated.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I saw the horrors they committed in the Absolute's name.

289.speaker: Sazza
289.text: And the fun we had committin' 'em.

127.speaker: Fezzerk
127.text: Thank you. I'm glad someone noticed.

95.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
95.text: I'm sure they were very enthusiastic. But zeal without efficacy is for children. Not servants.

86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
86.text: We are too close to the ending - and the new beginning. I can coddle failure no longer.

215.speaker: Sazza
215.text: Don't listen, General! I never met this scrag before in me life.

347.speaker: Fezzerk
347.text: Lies! I served the Absolute - I did everything I was told!

220.speaker: Drenn
220.text: It ain't true! We're good as anyone - just give us a chance.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Attack the half-orc and the general.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: I, too, crave blood. But even I know to avoid battle when fortune's tides flow against me.
35.context: NodeContext: Player is about to attack a boss who will almost definitely kill you.

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: Wait - we don't exactly have the advantage here.
121.context: NodeContext: Player is about to attack a boss who will almost definitely kill you.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: Hold on, soldier. We don't stand a chance against this mob. We'll have our moment, but this isn't it.
16.context: NodeContext: Player is about to attack a boss who will almost definitely kill you.

100.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
100.text: Well, True Soul? What about the goblins?

94.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
94.text: How amusing. Take care of them, Z'rell.

150.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
150.text: Take her below. We can deal with her once the apostate is dead.
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse animation from N3182 ("Spoken to guards, who grab Minthara and lead her away.")InternalNodeContext: "Her/She" referring to Minthara. "Apostate" referring to the player.NodeContext: Spoken to guards, telling them to take away a prisoner. 'The apostate' = the player who's about to attack him

133.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
133.context: NodeContext: with a grin, preparing to attack the player

258.speaker: Astarion
258.text: I appreciate the enthusiasm, but I'm not sure this is the time or the place.
258.context: NodeContext: Quietly, to the player. They're about to attack a boss who'll DEFINITELY kill you.

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: Keep calm. Even the Blade of Frontiers knows when he's outmatched.
39.context: NodeContext: Player is about to attack a boss who will almost definitely kill you.

149.speaker: Gale
149.text: I'd reconsider. He's not exactly open to attack just now.
149.context: NodeContext: Player is about to attack a boss who will almost definitely kill you.

349.speaker: Narrator
349.text: *You're standing in the lion's den, facing a legendary general, his guards, and who knows what eldritch powers. Just in case you needed a reminder.*
349.context: NodeContext: The player is about to attack someone that's probably going to absolutely crush them, and we're reminding them it might not be a great idea

213.speaker: Drenn
213.text: We did as we were told! We're loyal to the Absolute - tell 'im!

324.speaker: Narrator
324.text: *Z'rell's mind is a steel trap - sharp, strong, and ready to clamp down on anything that intrudes. There's no way in.*

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Try to force your will on Ketheric - push him to declare Minthara innocent.

322.speaker: Narrator
322.text: *In Ketheric's place, you feel an absence. No psionic power. No tadpole at all.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *Your mind extends outward and grasps at... nothing.*

297.speaker: Fezzerk
297.text: We did as we was told, General! Followed every order -

AD_DrennPlea_1.speaker: Drenn
AD_DrennPlea_1.text: Wish I was back with my tribe.

AD_DrennPlea_2.speaker: Drenn
AD_DrennPlea_2.context: NodeContext: talking quietly about Ketheric, who is nearby

Guard_005_0.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005_0.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Disgruntled, wants to get on her with work

Guard_005_1.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005_1.text: Don't try giving orders, True Soul. Everyone here answers directly to Z'rell.
Guard_005_1.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Stiff, self-important - we technically outrank her but she won't be pushed around

Guard_005_2.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005_2.text: I expect to be made True Soul myself by the time the fighting's done. Watch me.
Guard_005_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Sees herself as our equal, a little cocky and defiant about it

Guard_005_3.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005_3.text: Settle your affairs, True Soul. The waiting's almost over.
Guard_005_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Relish, anticipation of the fight ahead

DaisyAD_PostExecution_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_PostExecution_2.text: The seat of the Absolute's power - occupied by a General that cannot be killed. But his followers are flesh and blood.

DaisyAD_PostExecution_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_PostExecution_0.text: We must learn what fuels his power.

DaisyAD_PostExecution_1.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_PostExecution_1.text: We must learn more about his power.

Guard_003_0.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: a blessing / saying in their church

Guard_003_1.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003_1.text: Can't say I'll miss this place. Absolute deserves a church, not a ruin.
Guard_003_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Looking around the tower chamber, unimpressed

Guard_003_2.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003_2.text: You'll find traders in the entrance hall. Absolute draws coin as well as pilgrims, eh?
Guard_003_2.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: trying to be helpful

Guard_003_3.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003_3.text: It's bloody happening. We're finally going.
Guard_003_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Excited

AD_FezzerkPlea_0.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_FezzerkPlea_0.text: I don't know nothing about any of this.

AD_FezzerkPlea_1.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_FezzerkPlea_1.context: NodeContext: accusatory, raising voice to be heard in a loud room

AD_MintharaPlea_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_MintharaPlea_2.text: Hold your tongues in General Thorm's presence.

CombatInterruption_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_0.context: NodeContext: 'rest in turmoil' - spellcasting combat VB - ( rekwiˈɛsk-ænt in tuː.mʌl.tu )

CombatInterruption_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_1.text: The first time I died, it took an army to put me in the ground. What chance do you have?

CombatInterruption_3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_3.text: What is your name, True Soul?

CombatInterruption_6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_6.text: You. Impossible. You should never have come back here. Z'rell - kill this wastrel.

CombatInterruption_12.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_12.text: Funny - you know, I don't know why I asked. Z'rell: Kill this fool.
CombatInterruption_12.context: NodeContext: Maybe a bit of comedy here. 'Funny' (stern). 'And sad' (mockery). 'Zrel: kill him' (dead seriousness)

CombatInterruption_2.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_2.text: I suppose it doesn't. Z'rell: Kill this fool.
CombatInterruption_2.context: NodeContext: Maybe a bit of comedy here. 'Funny' (stern). 'And sad' (mockery). 'Zrel: kill him' (dead seriousness)

CombatInterruption_16.speaker: Player
CombatInterruption_16.text: You can call me 'The Death of Ketheric Thorm.'

CombatInterruption_19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_19.text: Funny. And sad. Z'rell: Kill this fool.
CombatInterruption_19.context: NodeContext: Maybe a bit of comedy here. 'Funny' (stern). 'And sad' (mockery). 'Zrel: kill him' (dead seriousness)

CombatInterruption_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_4.context: NodeContext: 'embrace death' - spellcasting V|B in combat. mɔrt̪əm äm plek-tɛɚɪs

CombatInterruption_7.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_7.context: NodeContext: '(return) to dust' - combat VB (add pul.u̯is)

CombatInterruption_8.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_8.text: Death comes to all, and all that die come to me.

CombatInterruption_11.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_11.text: My army will march. The city will burn. Death's design will be complete.

CombatInterruption_14.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_14.text: Every battle I fight provides fresh recruits for my army of the dead. Soon, we will be legion.

CombatInterruption_15.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
CombatInterruption_15.text: I don't know who you think you are to disturb these proceedings, but I will exact your contrition from your flesh.

CombatInterruption_18.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption_18.context: NodeContext: 'spirits from the grave' - spellcasting VB in combat. spiː.ri.tus eks seˈpulkɾo

Guard_004_0.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Blessing

Guard_004_1.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_1.text: You rescued the General's advisor? Can't say I missed the screaming from his chambers.
Guard_004_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Frightened, wary of Balthazar (the general's advisor)

Guard_004_2.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_2.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Respectful

Guard_004_3.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

Guard_004_4.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_4.text: See you in the city, True Soul. My family's bakery will be spared - we'll have ourselves a feast.
Guard_004_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Anticipation, friendly (he's certain the cult's invasion won't harm his family)

Guard_004_5.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004_5.text: I won't keep you, True Soul. Always Her work to be done.
Guard_004_5.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Respectful but growing uncomfortable - we're high-ranking and not someone whose attention he wants to draw
